synopsis: In episode #7 of Pineapple Plant Rotation, hosts Devam and Ahir delve into the complexities of self-judgment and pain, sharing personal experiences and insights on growth and acceptance. They explore the importance of acknowledging one’s own emotions while navigating relationships and societal pressures, ultimately emphasizing the value of self-compassion and understanding.
quotes: You are loved solely where you may show weakness without provoking the strength.
I always wait too long to do every single thing.
It's easy to block out the world when you're insulated by privilege.
You can run from your pain, but that doesn’t mean it will go away.
Life can only be lived forwards but can only be understood backwards.
Self-judgment keeps me from being honest with myself.
You can't heal everybody; you can't please everyone.
Sometimes I'll just cry for hours, and afterwards, I feel a weightlessness.
Accepting your pain is the first step to understanding your limitations.
You have to trust yourself and what you decide to do spontaneously.
